item.description:
Let's try this again since Thursday night has been rained out.

What better way to celebrate summer and good writing than with Shakespeare outdoors on the Common?

This is a free event; it starts at 7:00, but it's easier to meet early to get good seats and space. It is open seating, so bring a towel or blanket to sit on if you can. I can probably bring a blanket to share with a few people. They are also renting chairs for $10 - you'll get back $3 when you return the chair.

Feel free to bring a picnic dinner. You could also pick something up after you arrive since there are plenty of shops and cafes in the area.

I'll send out my cell number Sunday afternoon to those that RSVP, so we can find each other once the Common starts filling up.

For more info about the Shakespeare on the Common and the play Othello: http://www.commshakes...

In case of rain, they will cancel and we'll either postpone to another date or give up, because rescheduling twice isn't always fun.
item.how_to_find_us: I'll send my cell number closer on since once it starts to fill up, it may be hard to find each other.
item.name: Shakespeare's Othello on Boston Common
